data.name: s1TopText
data.value: Projects enable you to coordinate tasks, issues, files and notes with multiple people anywhere around the world. This wizard will help you quickly set up a project and automatically send invitations to other people who will be on your project team.

data.name: s1ProjectTitle
data.value: What do you want to Call Your Project ?

data.name: s1ProjectType
data.value: What type of Project is this?

data.name: s1Client
data.value: Who is Your Customer or Client?

data.name: s1QuickTip
data.value:
Quick Tip: If you are a Microsoft Project user, you can use our project import and export tools to rapidly synchronize project plans with the portal.
Check out the User Guides for more information on this advanced feature.

data.name: s2EndDate
data.value: What is the Target End Date?

data.name: s2Executive
data.value: Do you have an Executive Manager?

data.name: s2ExecutiveComment
data.value: If you do not have one, you can choose ‘none’.

data.name: s2Budget
data.value: Do You have a Known Budget?

data.name: s2QuickTip
data.value: It is important to enter a start date and targeted end date for your project. Once your project is created portal will use these dates to help you when you are managing tasks and other date sensitive information. Remember, you can always change these later on.

data.name: s3QuickTip
data.value: For reporting and filtering purposes you can choose from the categories you can select from the categories listed to the left. You project can be connected to multiple categories if you wish. Remember this can be changed later on.

data.name: s3SubTitle
data.value: Categorize Your Project for Reporting and Filtering

data.name: s4TopText
data.value: You can now select from the available users in the portal to add people to your project team. If you need to add a person who is not in the portal directory you can do that once the project has been created.

data.name: s4QuickTip
data.value: You can use the group and search functions to the left to show available resources that you can then add to the project team.

data.name: s6TopText
data.value: Review the information below and click create and your project will be created for you and your project team.

data.name: s6SubTitle
data.value: Finalizing Your Project and Sending Notifications

data.name: s7TopText
data.value: You will now be placed into the main project management screen to perform a number of additional functions with your project.

data.name: s7TextHeader
data.value: What Else Can You Do with Your Project?

data.name: s7Text
data.value:
• Use the Issues Tracking to record issues related to your project;
  • Add Files/Documents to your project you wish to share with the team;
  • Create targeted tasks for specific resources to track individual efforts;
  • Schedule events and meetings for different aspects of your project;
  • Add financial items to further refine your budget and to stay on track;
  • Import and Export Microsoft Project Plans;
  • Run reports to assess your projects status.

data.name: GlobalTitle
data.value: You Are Creating a New Project To Manage and Track

data.name: s5Description
data.value: What is the Description of Your Project?

data.name: s5Scope
data.value: What is the Scope of Your Project?

data.name: s5Goals
data.value: What are the Goals of Your Project?

data.name: s5Deliverables
data.value: What are the Deliverables of Your Project?

data.name: s1Priority
data.value: What priority of Project is this?

data.name: s1Phase
data.value: What phase of Project is this?
